info.title: Honcho API
info.summary: An API for adding personalization to AI Apps
info.description:
This API is used to store data and get insights about users for AI
    applications

get.description:
Get an App by ID

Args:
    app_id (uuid.UUID): The ID of the app

Returns:
    schemas.App: App object

x-codeSamples.source:
import os
from honcho import Honcho

client = Honcho(
    # This is the default and can be omitted
    api_key=os.environ.get("HONCHO_AUTH_TOKEN"),
)
app = client.apps.get(
    "182bd5e5-6e1a-4fe4-a799-aa6d9a6ab26e",
)
print(app.id)

put.description:
Update an App

Args:
    app_id (uuid.UUID): The ID of the app to update
    app (schemas.AppUpdate): The App object containing any new metadata

Returns:
    schemas.App: The App object of the updated App

x-codeSamples.source:
import os
from honcho import Honcho

client = Honcho(
    # This is the default and can be omitted
    api_key=os.environ.get("HONCHO_AUTH_TOKEN"),
)
app = client.apps.update(
    "182bd5e5-6e1a-4fe4-a799-aa6d9a6ab26e",
)
print(app.id)

get.description:
Get an App by Name

Args:
    app_name (str): The name of the app

Returns:
    schemas.App: App object

x-codeSamples.source:
import os
from honcho import Honcho

client = Honcho(
    # This is the default and can be omitted
    api_key=os.environ.get("HONCHO_AUTH_TOKEN"),
)
app = client.apps.get_by_name(
    "string",
)
print(app.id)

post.description:
Create an App

Args:
    app (schemas.AppCreate): The App object containing any metadata

Returns:
    schemas.App: Created App object

x-codeSamples.source:
import os
from honcho import Honcho

client = Honcho(
    # This is the default and can be omitted
    api_key=os.environ.get("HONCHO_AUTH_TOKEN"),
)
app = client.apps.create(
    name="string",
)
print(app.id)

get.description:
Get or Create an App

Args:
    app_name (str): The name of the app

Returns:
    schemas.App: App object

x-codeSamples.source:
import os
from honcho import Honcho

client = Honcho(
    # This is the default and can be omitted
    api_key=os.environ.get("HONCHO_AUTH_TOKEN"),
)
app = client.apps.get_or_create(
    "string",
)
print(app.id)

post.description:
Create a User

Args:
    app_id (uuid.UUID): The ID of the app representing the client application using
    honcho
    user (schemas.UserCreate): The User object containing any metadata

Returns:
    schemas.User: Created User object

x-codeSamples.source:
import os
from honcho import Honcho

client = Honcho(
    # This is the default and can be omitted
    api_key=os.environ.get("HONCHO_AUTH_TOKEN"),
)
user = client.apps.users.create(
    "182bd5e5-6e1a-4fe4-a799-aa6d9a6ab26e",
    name="string",
)
print(user.id)

get.description:
Get All Users for an App

Args:
    app_id (uuid.UUID): The ID of the app representing the client
    application using honcho

Returns:
    list[schemas.User]: List of User objects

x-codeSamples.source:
import os
from honcho import Honcho

client = Honcho(
    # This is the default and can be omitted
    api_key=os.environ.get("HONCHO_AUTH_TOKEN"),
)
page = client.apps.users.list(
    "182bd5e5-6e1a-4fe4-a799-aa6d9a6ab26e",
)
user = page.items[0]
print(user.id)

get.description:
Get a User

Args:
    app_id (uuid.UUID): The ID of the app representing the client application using
    honcho
    user_id (str): The User ID representing the user, managed by the user

Returns:
    schemas.User: User object

x-codeSamples.source:
import os
from honcho import Honcho

client = Honcho(
    # This is the default and can be omitted
    api_key=os.environ.get("HONCHO_AUTH_TOKEN"),
)
user = client.apps.users.get_by_name(
    "string",
    app_id="182bd5e5-6e1a-4fe4-a799-aa6d9a6ab26e",
)
print(user.id)

Returns:

get.description:
Get or Create a User

Args:
    app_id (uuid.UUID): The ID of the app representing the client application using
    honcho

x-codeSamples.source:

get.description:
Get All Sessions for a User

Args:
    app_id (uuid.UUID): The ID of the app representing the client application using
    honcho
    user_id (uuid.UUID): The User ID representing the user, managed by the user
    location_id (str, optional): Optional Location ID representing the location of a
    session

Returns:
    list[schemas.Session]: List of Session objects

x-codeSamples.source:
import os
from honcho import Honcho

client = Honcho(
    # This is the default and can be omitted
    api_key=os.environ.get("HONCHO_AUTH_TOKEN"),
)
page = client.apps.users.sessions.list(
    "182bd5e5-6e1a-4fe4-a799-aa6d9a6ab26e",
    app_id="182bd5e5-6e1a-4fe4-a799-aa6d9a6ab26e",
)
session = page.items[0]
print(session.id)

post.description:
Create a Session for a User

Args:
    app_id (uuid.UUID): The ID of the app representing the client
    application using honcho
    user_id (uuid.UUID): The User ID representing the user, managed by the user
    session (schemas.SessionCreate): The Session object containing any
    metadata and a location ID

Returns:
    schemas.Session: The Session object of the new Session

x-codeSamples.source:
import os
from honcho import Honcho

client = Honcho(
    # This is the default and can be omitted
    api_key=os.environ.get("HONCHO_AUTH_TOKEN"),
)
session = client.apps.users.sessions.create(
    "182bd5e5-6e1a-4fe4-a799-aa6d9a6ab26e",
    app_id="182bd5e5-6e1a-4fe4-a799-aa6d9a6ab26e",
    location_id="string",
)
print(session.id)

put.description:
Update the metadata of a Session

Args:
    app_id (uuid.UUID): The ID of the app representing the client application using
    honcho
    user_id (uuid.UUID): The User ID representing the user, managed by the user
    session_id (uuid.UUID): The ID of the Session to update
    session (schemas.SessionUpdate): The Session object containing any new metadata

Returns:
    schemas.Session: The Session object of the updated Session

x-codeSamples.source:
import os
from honcho import Honcho

client = Honcho(
    # This is the default and can be omitted
    api_key=os.environ.get("HONCHO_AUTH_TOKEN"),
)
session = client.apps.users.sessions.update(
    "182bd5e5-6e1a-4fe4-a799-aa6d9a6ab26e",
    app_id="182bd5e5-6e1a-4fe4-a799-aa6d9a6ab26e",
    user_id="182bd5e5-6e1a-4fe4-a799-aa6d9a6ab26e",
)
print(session.id)

delete.description:
Delete a session by marking it as inactive

Args:
    app_id (uuid.UUID): The ID of the app representing the client application using
    honcho
    user_id (uuid.UUID): The User ID representing the user, managed by the user
    session_id (uuid.UUID): The ID of the Session to delete

Returns:
    dict: A message indicating that the session was deleted

Raises:
    HTTPException: If the session is not found

x-codeSamples.source:
import os
from honcho import Honcho

client = Honcho(
    # This is the default and can be omitted
    api_key=os.environ.get("HONCHO_AUTH_TOKEN"),
)
session = client.apps.users.sessions.delete(
    "182bd5e5-6e1a-4fe4-a799-aa6d9a6ab26e",
    app_id="182bd5e5-6e1a-4fe4-a799-aa6d9a6ab26e",
    user_id="182bd5e5-6e1a-4fe4-a799-aa6d9a6ab26e",
)
print(session)

get.description:
Get a specific session for a user by ID

Args:
    app_id (uuid.UUID): The ID of the app representing the client application using
    honcho
    user_id (uuid.UUID): The User ID representing the user, managed by the user
    session_id (uuid.UUID): The ID of the Session to retrieve

Returns:
    schemas.Session: The Session object of the requested Session

Raises:
    HTTPException: If the session is not found

x-codeSamples.source:
import os
from honcho import Honcho

client = Honcho(
    # This is the default and can be omitted
    api_key=os.environ.get("HONCHO_AUTH_TOKEN"),
)
session = client.apps.users.sessions.get(
    "182bd5e5-6e1a-4fe4-a799-aa6d9a6ab26e",
    app_id="182bd5e5-6e1a-4fe4-a799-aa6d9a6ab26e",
    user_id="182bd5e5-6e1a-4fe4-a799-aa6d9a6ab26e",
)
print(session.id)

import os
from honcho import Honcho

client = Honcho(
    # This is the default and can be omitted
    api_key=os.environ.get("HONCHO_AUTH_TOKEN"),
)
session = client.apps.users.sessions.chat(
    "182bd5e5-6e1a-4fe4-a799-aa6d9a6ab26e",
    app_id="182bd5e5-6e1a-4fe4-a799-aa6d9a6ab26e",
    user_id="182bd5e5-6e1a-4fe4-a799-aa6d9a6ab26e",
    query="string",
)
print(session.content)

import os
from honcho import Honcho

client = Honcho(
    # This is the default and can be omitted
    api_key=os.environ.get("HONCHO_AUTH_TOKEN"),
)
session = client.apps.users.sessions.stream(
    "182bd5e5-6e1a-4fe4-a799-aa6d9a6ab26e",
    app_id="182bd5e5-6e1a-4fe4-a799-aa6d9a6ab26e",
    user_id="182bd5e5-6e1a-4fe4-a799-aa6d9a6ab26e",
    query="string",
)
print(session)

post.description:
Adds a message to a session

Args:
    app_id (uuid.UUID): The ID of the app representing the client application using
    honcho
    user_id (str): The User ID representing the user, managed by the user
    session_id (int): The ID of the Session to add the message to
    message (schemas.MessageCreate): The Message object to add containing the
    message content and type

Returns:
    schemas.Message: The Message object of the added message

Raises:
    HTTPException: If the session is not found

x-codeSamples.source:
import os
from honcho import Honcho

client = Honcho(
    # This is the default and can be omitted
    api_key=os.environ.get("HONCHO_AUTH_TOKEN"),
)
message = client.apps.users.sessions.messages.create(
    "182bd5e5-6e1a-4fe4-a799-aa6d9a6ab26e",
    app_id="182bd5e5-6e1a-4fe4-a799-aa6d9a6ab26e",
    user_id="182bd5e5-6e1a-4fe4-a799-aa6d9a6ab26e",
    content="string",
    is_user=True,
)
print(message.id)

get.description:
Get all messages for a session

Args:
    app_id (uuid.UUID): The ID of the app representing the client application using
    honcho
    user_id (str): The User ID representing the user, managed by the user
    session_id (int): The ID of the Session to retrieve
    reverse (bool): Whether to reverse the order of the messages

Returns:
    list[schemas.Message]: List of Message objects

Raises:
    HTTPException: If the session is not found

x-codeSamples.source:
import os
from honcho import Honcho

client = Honcho(
    # This is the default and can be omitted
    api_key=os.environ.get("HONCHO_AUTH_TOKEN"),
)
page = client.apps.users.sessions.messages.list(
    "182bd5e5-6e1a-4fe4-a799-aa6d9a6ab26e",
    app_id="182bd5e5-6e1a-4fe4-a799-aa6d9a6ab26e",
    user_id="182bd5e5-6e1a-4fe4-a799-aa6d9a6ab26e",
)
message = page.items[0]
print(message.id)

import os
from honcho import Honcho

client = Honcho(
    # This is the default and can be omitted
    api_key=os.environ.get("HONCHO_AUTH_TOKEN"),
)
message = client.apps.users.sessions.messages.get(
    "182bd5e5-6e1a-4fe4-a799-aa6d9a6ab26e",
    app_id="182bd5e5-6e1a-4fe4-a799-aa6d9a6ab26e",
    user_id="182bd5e5-6e1a-4fe4-a799-aa6d9a6ab26e",
    session_id="182bd5e5-6e1a-4fe4-a799-aa6d9a6ab26e",
)
print(message.id)

post.description:
Adds a message to a session

Args:
    app_id (uuid.UUID): The ID of the app representing the client application using
    honcho
    user_id (str): The User ID representing the user, managed by the user
    session_id (int): The ID of the Session to add the message to
    message (schemas.MessageCreate): The Message object to add containing the
    message content and type

Returns:
    schemas.Message: The Message object of the added message

Raises:
    HTTPException: If the session is not found

x-codeSamples.source:
import os
from honcho import Honcho

client = Honcho(
    # This is the default and can be omitted
    api_key=os.environ.get("HONCHO_AUTH_TOKEN"),
)
metamessage = client.apps.users.sessions.metamessages.create(
    "182bd5e5-6e1a-4fe4-a799-aa6d9a6ab26e",
    app_id="182bd5e5-6e1a-4fe4-a799-aa6d9a6ab26e",
    user_id="182bd5e5-6e1a-4fe4-a799-aa6d9a6ab26e",
    content="string",
    message_id="182bd5e5-6e1a-4fe4-a799-aa6d9a6ab26e",
    metamessage_type="string",
)
print(metamessage.id)

get.description:
Get all messages for a session

Args:
    app_id (uuid.UUID): The ID of the app representing the client application using
    honcho
    user_id (str): The User ID representing the user, managed by the user
    session_id (int): The ID of the Session to retrieve
    reverse (bool): Whether to reverse the order of the metamessages

Returns:
    list[schemas.Message]: List of Message objects

Raises:
    HTTPException: If the session is not found

x-codeSamples.source:

    user_id="182bd5e5-6e1a-4fe4-a799-aa6d9a6ab26e",
)
metamessage = page.items[0]
print(metamessage.id)

get.description:
Get All Collections for a User

Args:
    app_id (uuid.UUID): The ID of the app representing the client
    application using honcho
    user_id (uuid.UUID): The User ID representing the user, managed by the user

Returns:
    list[schemas.Collection]: List of Collection objects

x-codeSamples.source:
import os
from honcho import Honcho

client = Honcho(
    # This is the default and can be omitted
    api_key=os.environ.get("HONCHO_AUTH_TOKEN"),
)
page = client.apps.users.collections.list(
    "182bd5e5-6e1a-4fe4-a799-aa6d9a6ab26e",
    app_id="182bd5e5-6e1a-4fe4-a799-aa6d9a6ab26e",
)
collection = page.items[0]
print(collection.id)

)

x-codeSamples.source:
import os
from honcho import Honcho

client = Honcho(
    # This is the default and can be omitted
    api_key=os.environ.get("HONCHO_AUTH_TOKEN"),
)
collection = client.apps.users.collections.query(
    "182bd5e5-6e1a-4fe4-a799-aa6d9a6ab26e",
    app_id="182bd5e5-6e1a-4fe4-a799-aa6d9a6ab26e",
    user_id="182bd5e5-6e1a-4fe4-a799-aa6d9a6ab26e",
    query="string",
)
print(collection)
